gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Soil Water Index Static Layers (raster 12.5 km), global - version 3

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The Soil Water Index (SWI) Static Layer collection provides static masks and ancillary files that aid in the analysis of the daily SWI, 10-daily SWI or SWI Time Series products. These include (i) a DGG file to find Discrete Global Grid cell corresponding to a given location, (ii) a tropical Forest Mask (FM), (iii) a Topographic Complexity (TC) mask, a (iv) Wetland Fraction (WF) mask and (iv) Correlation Information (CI) that shows the correlation with Global Land Data Assimilation (GLDAS) models.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: This product is first designed to fit the requirements of the Global component of Land Service of the Copernicus programme. It can be also useful for all applications related to environmental monitoring.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: SWI Static Layer products were generated by the Global Land Service of Copernicus, the Earth Observation programme of the European Commission. The research leading to the current version of the product has received funding from various European Commission Research and Technical Development programs. The products are based on Metop/ASCAT surface soil moisture data distributed by EUMETSAT or external data sources such as GTOPO30 and the Globl Lake and Wetland Database (GLWD).

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Central Institute for Meteorology and Geodynamics
European Commission Directorate-General for Internal Market, Industry, Entrepreneurship and SMEs
European Commission Directorate-General Joint Research Centre

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: EC DG-JRC Institute for Environment and Sustainability

gmd:fileDescription.gco:CharacterString: Image from the tropical Forest Mask

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: (d) the confidentiality of commercial or industrial information, where such confidentiality is provided for by national or Community law to protect a legitimate economic interest, including the public interest in maintaining statistical confidentiality and tax secrecy.

gmd:otherConstraints.gmx:Anchor: Limitation d acc s public bas sur l article 13(1) de la directive INSPIRE

gmd:orderingInstructions.gco:CharacterString: Products can be downloaded online via HTTP or can be received through EUMETCast satellite reception in Europe, Africa and Latin-America.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Validation results conform CEOS LPV guidelines

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: COMMISSION REGULATION (EU) No 1089/2010 of 23 November 2010 implementing Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards interoperability of spatial data sets and services

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: This data set is conformant with the INSPIRE Implementing Rules for the interoperability of spatial data sets and services

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: INSPIRE Data Specification on orthoimagery - Guidelines

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: The SWI_TS product is a reformatting of the SWI daily product into a time series format which makes it easier to perform local, time series based analysis without having to download and convert data for the whole globe. The time series data is provided on a Discrete Global Grid (DGG) with a grid point spacing of 12.5 km. This grid contains a total of 3,264,391 points of which 839,826 are over land areas. This grid has the advantage of reducing the data volume of the product while not loosing any information. This is the case because the SWI image product is oversampled to a 0.1° grid from this DGG and would contain 1,814,400 points over land.
